title: Autism and Vaccines
description: Vaccines do not cause autism. The scientific data show no relationship between vaccines, thimerosal and autism. Learn more.
cleaned_text: Vaccines Do Not Cause Autism There is no correlation between autism and vaccines. This has been confirmed through dozens of scientific studies examining different types of vaccines and different vaccine timing schedules. Researchers have also studied thimerosal, a mercury-based preservative used in many vaccines, to see if it had any relation to autism. The results are clear: The data show no relationship between vaccines, thimerosal and autism. Vaccinate Your Children Protect your children by getting them vaccinated, and follow the vaccination schedule outlined by your child's pediatrician. Vaccines do not cause autism.
